item.title: Destinee add a quote by Meg Rosoff
item.description: "I don't get nearly enough credit in life for the things I manage not to say." -- Meg Rosoff

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "Every arrangement in life carried with it the sadness, the sentimental shadow, of its not being something else, but only itself. " -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Destinee add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Ellen Potter
item.description: "It's alarming how quickly people adjust to adventures when they are in one. You really have to work at being astonished by life." -- Ellen Potter

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Amy Krouse Rosenthal
item.description: "It would be difficult to convince me that leaning has no effect whatsoever on the outcome of my bowling." -- Amy Krouse Rosenthal

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "There are so many ways to go wrong. All we've got are metaphors, and they're never exactly right. You can never just Say. The. Thing." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Destinee add a quote by E.M. Forster
Destinee add a quote by Martin Jenkins
item.description: "When it comes to looking after all the species that are already endangered, there's such a lot to do that sometimes it might all seem to be too much, especially when there are so many other important things to worry about. But if we stop trying, the chances are that pretty soon we'll end up with a world where there are no tigers or elephants, or sawfishes or whooping cranes, or albatrosses or ground iguanas. And I think that would be a shame, don't you?" -- Martin Jenkins

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Cynthia Levinson
item.description: "On Thursday morning, May 2, 1963, nine-year-old Audrey Faye Hendricks woke up with freedom on her mind. But, before she could be free, there was something important she had to do. "I want to go to jail," Audrey had told her mother. Since Mr. and Mrs. Hendricks thought that was a good idea, they helped her get ready." -- Cynthia Levinson

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Ramona Quimby as written by Beverly Cleary
item.description: "If she can't spell, why is she a librarian? Librarians should know how to spell." -- Ramona Quimby as written by Beverly Cleary

item.title: Destinee add a quote by Mary Norton
Destinee add a quote by R.J. Palacio
item.description: "If every person in this room made it a rule that wherever you are, whenever you can, you wil try to act a little kinder than is necessary - the world really would be a better place. And if you do this, if you act just a little kinder than is necessary, someone else, somewhere, someday, may recognize in you, in every single one of you, the face of God." -- R.J. Palacio
